intro: Euphrasia gracilis var. tetraquetra, commonly known as the slender eyebright, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs. It is valued in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties, though its botanical significance lies in its ecological role and floral structure.
